meanings.definition: To divide into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys halving the cake with her sister.
meanings.sent2: The chef is halving the recipe to make a smaller portion.
meanings.sent3: The magician halved the lady into two parts, but she was still smiling!
meanings.sent4: His decision to halve his workload was like cutting a burden in half.
meanings.sent5: The sun seemed to be halving the sky with its bright rays.

meanings.definition: The action of cutting something in half.
meanings.sent1: The halving of the sandwich made it easier to share.
meanings.sent2: I watched the halving of the log into two perfect pieces.
meanings.sent3: The halving of the chocolate bar revealed a surprise inside.
meanings.sent4: The halving of the distance seemed to make the journey shorter.
meanings.sent5: The halving of the curtain allowed just enough light to filter through.
